SEARCH
Package nl.pim16aap2.testing

Class AssistedFactoryMocker<T,U>

java.lang.Object
nl.pim16aap2.testing.AssistedFactoryMocker<T,U>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of the class that is instantiated by the factory.
U - The type of the factory that instantiates the target class.
public class AssistedFactoryMocker<T,U> extends Object
Represents a class that can be used to create mocked objects for an AssistedFactory.

Any dependencies that cannot be mocked will default to null. These can later be manually updated using setMock(Class, String, Object) if needed.

Author:
Pim

    • getMock

      @Contract("true, _, _ -> !null") public <V> V getMock(boolean nonNull, Class<V> type, @Nullable @Nullable String name)
      Gets the mocked object of the given type.
      Type Parameters:
      V - The type of the mocked object to get.
      Parameters:
      nonNull - Whether to allow null values. If this is true, an exception will be thrown in case the return value would be null.
      type - The type of the mocked object to get.
      name - The name of the mocked object, as specified by Assisted.value() in the constructor..
      Returns:
      The mocked object of the given type with the given name.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when null values are not allowed and no existing mock exists for the given type and name combination.

    • hasMock

      public boolean hasMock(Class<?> type, @Nullable @Nullable String name)
      Checks if the assisted factory mocker has a mocked object of the given type and with the given name.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of the mocked object to get.
      name - The name of the mocked object, as specified by Assisted.value() in the constructor.
      Returns:
      True if a mocked object exists of the given type and name.

    • setMock

      public <V> AssistedFactoryMocker<T,U> setMock(Class<V> type, V mock)
      See setMock(Class, String, Object).

      Shortcut for unnamed parameters.

    • setMock

      public <V> AssistedFactoryMocker<T,U> setMock(Class<V> type, @Nullable @Nullable String name, V mock)
      Sets the mocked instance of a constructor parameter.

      Only works for parameters that do not exist in the factory method.

      Type Parameters:
      V - The type of the mocked object.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of the mocked object.
      name - The name of the mocked object, as specified by Assisted.value() in the constructor.
      mock - The new mocked object to use as constructor parameter.
      Returns:
      The current AssistedFactoryMocker instance.
